alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 8:51PM PDT until August 02 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low lying areas around Humboldt Bay. Up to one quarter of a foot of saltwater inundation above ground level is possible in low lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (Between 8.8 and 8.9 feet MLLW at the north spit tide gauge). * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 2 AM PDT Wednesday.. . * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT.
